title: Game of Thrones almost gave Jaime and Cersei Lannister much more gruesome deaths
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Not all of our favourites made it out of the final season of Game of Thrones alive.

Two characters who met their makers in the final run of the hit fantasy drama Game of Thrones were Queen Cersei Lannister (Lena Headey) and her twin brother and lover Ser Jaime Lannister (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau).

In the penultimate episode The Bells, Jaime fought his way through the chaos in and around King's Landing to be reunited with his beloved as the Red Keep collapsed around them due to the onslaught brought on by Queen Daenerys Targaryen (Emilia Clarke).

Eventually finding themselves in the caverns beneath the Red Keep, Jaime was unable to find a way for them to escape with their unborn child, and instead he held the crying Cersei as the ceiling caved in on them.

The finale then saw their younger brother Tyrion Lannister (Peter Dinklage) explore the wreckage before finding their bodies and breaking down.

However, the recently seen scripts for the The Bells and The Iron Throne have revealed that their end was actually even more gruesome on the page.

(Image: HBO)

According to Insider, the scrips revealed that Tyrion wouldn't have found their more-or-less perfectly preserved bodies in the last episode and instead "all of the skulls have been blackened and scorched by the extreme heat of the fires that raged for hours."

Some fans had questioned from the finale that all the twins would have needed to do to survive would have been to side-step some collapsing rubble, which the more fiery demise would have removed the possibility of.

Yet, we wouldn't have had the more tragic image of Tyrion staring at their artfully composed corpses in an embrace, would we?

Earlier this year, however, actress Lena Headey revealed her own hang-ups about Cersei's end.

What did you think of the end for Jaime and Cersei? Let us know in the comments below.
description: Game of Thrones season 8 ended in tragedy (or just desserts?) for Jaime and Cersei Lannister
